intro: Psephellus oltensis, commonly known as the Olt Valley spurge, is a flowering plant native to Romania. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It is often found in mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
